intro: Eriogonum pondii, commonly known as the Townsend's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and chaparral areas. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are generally hairy as well. Eriogonum pondii is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
